reviews.text: The comedy shows are awesome! They bring in a lot of talent. The food is pretty good, too. My only gripe is with the beer. Don't get me wrong, the selection is alright, and so is everything that comes in a can or a bottle. However, for whatever reason, the stuff they have on tap is always a bit watery and musky. Aside from that, this place is great, and I highly recommend that you check it out!

Amazing food for a "bar" I had the steak and cheese and roasted brussel sprouts. Went for the comedy night, well worth the price. Show up 30 minutes early for good seats. You can eat during the show, but service to the tables can be slow during a sold out event, so it's wise to get food early. Drinks are a decent price. Don't hesitate on getting tickets as day of the show it typically sells out

Great music but 1 of the female bartenders was very rude and threw a straw at me when I asked for one after she didn't stir a cocktail after making it. All other staff was friendly and despite this, I had a great time!
funny and I did open mic night and the audience is great too
My son performed there great place atmosphere and food Nd drinks on point!!

If you are looking for Indian food near monument circle in Indianapolis then this is the best place. Ambience is good. They serve traditional North Indian food with drinks. Not so crowded, spacious and easily accessible. Overall good experience with this restaurant.

Been eating my way around Indy 2yrs now and this is without question the BEST place around. 

Food: Unbeatable. Absolutely stellar.  Whether you're a carnivore, vegetarian, vegan or otherwise, there are delicious options for all.  

Staff: Their courtesy and friendliness is only outdone by their genuine interest in giving you an ideal dining experience.  

Price: Very fair.  

Highly recommend.
Had lunch there today with my office. First time there. We all had the buffet. All left stuffed. Lots of goodness on the buffet. Restaurant was very clean and staff extra friendly.

Oh my goodness this treasure is so worth getting out in the snow to dine inside! The lunch buffet was everything I needed! The only thing that could have made this meal better was parking, but they can't control the city meters. Definitely plan out parking when you come and give yourself time to enjoy the buffet. A lunch hour doesn't do it justice!

Not authentic Indian food. It is how majority of the "Indian" restaurants have become in America, trying to adjust their food according to the "American" crowds taste(sweet, not spicy and dull) and in the process they are no longer serving Indian food.

Owner has not taken any steps to make his food Indian. Infact the food has got more and more sugar added to it since my last review. You don't feel like eating dessert by end of the meal cause you are already high on sugar.

The cheese cake factory is an old favorite of mine. My family and I would come here for special occasions when I was a child and I loved their Linda Fudge cake. They still have it!!! And it is as delicious as ever! Since I’ve grown into adulthood some 15 years later, they have switched up the menu and still have a great handle on the savory tastes they’ve always fished out. I’ll keep coming, and I’ll bring my kids here too.

The bartenders terrible attitude defined my experience. Calling the dining room manager a tool would b giving him a compliment. I could have given 5 Stars if they would have handled my complaint better. It's a great place in a great location

Big disappointment at this location.

We very much like The Cheesecake Factory , however here the food quality was terrible compared to other locations. We could not even finish our meals. 

The fries tasted like reheated, despite we sent it back and was redone. Second time the fries tasted still like a chewable gum fries. 
The portions were also seemed smaller and over spiced. 
Our main waiter was kind and helpful, however when  our food was brought out by another waiter and we asked something from him - to bring some more toasts - we never heard back.

We really looked forward this culinary experience and were really sorry for the disappointment.  We will most likely avoid the chain for a while.

Lace made our experience really enjoyable and accommodating! We were catching a flight home after our trip to the cheesecake factory and she was very helpful to make sure our service was quick and helped us keep our luggage safe. Definitely will come back when we are here again!

The food was great. Very big portions. My only complaint is that it was extremely warm inside. I'm not sure if its because the restaurant was full of people or if the AC just needed to be turned up just a little bit. But overall it was great.

Always a great place for a party atmosphere. Such a fun place to go with a group. If you don't like it loud this place isn't for you. Good German food that's a bit pricey but you're paying for the entertainment aspects really.

A must try adventure in Vegas!

I'm not a beer drinker, and I don't like too much noise, so I went early to avoid the crowds. I wanted some good German food, and they didn't disappoint. The schnitzel and spätzle were both delicious, the wurst were fantastic, and the pretzel made me want to eat 5 more. The servers were very friendly and attentive. Wonderful place to visit, even if you're not into the beer/tavern scene.

Great food, very quick service. Traditional Octoberfest style seating. Friendly staff dressed in traditional garb. Live band that wasn't too loud. If I had to offer a criticism, the German rye bread was just a slice, not a warm, crusty miniature loaf. Still a great overall meal.

I have always had a great time here. Food is great, and the atmosphere is the best!

My only complaint is if you call for a reservation, ensure you request for the hall. I called, and was told it was not busy, so we did not need to make a reservation. We showed up and were told the only seats available were in the back biergarten.  

Service is great! No complaints at all, other than seating placement!

This place was amazing. I'm in Vegas on a work trip so had a group of 15 people. They easily accommodate big groups here. They have German music with entertainment the entire meal. The service was good, and the food was amazing. I'm super picky when it comes to food, but I ordered #365 and it was a pork platter with mashed potatoes and it's some of the best pork I've ever had will come back again next time in Vegas!
